lines.text: Thermal energy: Energy of molecules that make up matter
Temperature: Measure of average kinetic energy of molecules
Heat flows spontaneously from hot to cold

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we measure thermal energy, temperature, and heat within matter?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_k455:Thermal energy] is the energy due to the energy of molecules within an object. Temperature is the measure of kinetic energy (motion) of molecules. Heat is the transfer of thermal energy.
2. The four states of matter are [OBJ:expsec_k457:solids], [OBJ:expsec_k458:liquids], [OBJ:expsec_k459:gases], and [OBJ:expsec_k460:plasma].
